verb.description: Voluntarily leave a job or other position.
examples: he resigned from the government in protest at the policy

verb.description: Accept that something undesirable cannot be avoided.
examples: she resigned herself to a lengthy session
he seems resigned to a shortened career
synonyms: have no choice but to accept
get used to the idea of

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French resigner, from Latin resignare unseal, cancel, from re- back + signare sign, seal.
